sage.scene.bounding

Class BoundingSphere

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.scene.bounding.BoundingVolume
      • sage.scene.bounding.BoundingSphere
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class BoundingSphere
extends BoundingVolume
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    This class defines a BoundingVolume which is a sphere. Every BoundingSphere has a center and a radius.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class sage.scene.bounding.BoundingVolume

        BoundingVolume.BVType

      • contains

        public boolean contains(graphicslib3D.Point3D p)
        Returns true if this BoundingSphere contains the specified point; otherwise returns false. Points lying on the surface of the sphere are considered to be contained by the sphere.
        Specified by:
        contains in class BoundingVolume
        Parameters:
        p - the point about which containment by the sphere is being queried
        Returns:
        true if this BoundingSphere contains p; false otherwise

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(BoundingVolume otherBV)
        Returns true if the specified BoundingVolume intersects this BoundingSphere. Note: touching is considered intersecting.

        Warning: currently this method is only capable of comparing this BoundingSphere with another BoundingSphere; passing any other type of BoundingVolume to this method causes it to throw UnsupportedOperationException.

        Specified by:
        intersects in class BoundingVolume
        Parameters:
        otherBV - - the BoundingVolume to check for intersection with this BoundingVolume
        Returns:
        true if this BV intersects the specified BV

      • transformBy

        public BoundingVolume transformBy(graphicslib3D.Matrix3D mat,
                                  double[] scaleValues)
        Applies the specified transformation to the center point (location) of this BoundingSphere. Scales the radius of the BoundingSphereusing the maximum of the three values stored in the scaleValues parameter.
        Specified by:
        transformBy in class BoundingVolume
        Parameters:
        mat - The transformation matrix to be applied to this sphere's center
        scaleValues - - an array of doubles holding the x, y, and z scale values of the matrix transforming this bounding volume.
        Returns:
        this, transformed

      • isOnNegativeSide

        public boolean isOnNegativeSide(Plane pl)
        Returns true if this BoundingSphere lies completely on the negative side of the specified Plane; returns false if any portion of this BoundingSphere touches or lies on the positive side of the specified Plane. Note that this method assumes both the center of this BoundingSphere and the coefficients of the specified Plane are given in world coordinates; it is the responsibility of the invoking application to insure this condition.
        Specified by:
        isOnNegativeSide in class BoundingVolume
        Parameters:
        pl - - the Plane against which to test this BoundingVolume
        Returns:
        true if this BV lies entirely on the negative side of the plane

      • merge

        public BoundingVolume merge(BoundingVolume otherBV)
        Returns a BoundingVolume which surrounds both this BoundingSphere and the specified BoundingVolume. If the specified BoundingVolume is a BoundingSphere then a new BoundingSphere containing both this BoundingSphere and the specified BoundingSphere is returned. If the specified BoundingVolume is null then this BoundingSphere is returned. If the specified BoundingVolume is not a BoundingSphere then an exception is thrown; the current implementation does not support merging a BoundingSphere with any BoundingVolume type other than another BoundingSphere.
        Specified by:
        merge in class BoundingVolume
        Parameters:
        otherBV - - the BoundingVolume which is to be merged with this BoundingSphere
        Returns:
        a BoundingVolume which contains this BoundingSphere and the specified BoundingVolume

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Returns a deep clone (copy) of this BoundingSphere.
        Overrides:
        clone in class BoundingVolume
        Returns:
        A BoundingSphere which is a deep clone of this BoundingSphere.
